content.description: This is a good toprope for beginners. Due to the lack of gear, it is highly recommended not to lead.
content.location:
It is right of '

Toddler Massage

' and left of '

Teen Spirit

'. This is the second route from the right.

content.description:
This is probably the best route at the crag. Two bolts lead to a hard yet lower angle crack that takes good finger-sized gear. Use the same start and ending as '

No Pants, No Problem

.'
content.protection: Three bolts and some finger-sized cams. You could place a medium-sized nut if desired, but it is not necessary.
content.location:
It is just right of '

No Pants, No Problem

' sharing its first bolt, last bolt, and anchors and is just left of the '

The Worm Hole

.'

content.description: This route can take gear up top but needs an additional bolt or two. Leaders, beware!
content.location: Teen Spirit is the furthest right route.

content.description: Shake and Bake is one of the better climbs and is worthy of stars.
content.protection: Bolts to a one bolt anchor.
content.location: It is the second route from the left when facing the crag.

content.description:
This is the longest route on the wall which starts with easier climbing and progressively gets harder. The crux is at the last bolt.

The name comes from the Outdoor Industry MBA at Western Colorado University's Inaugural Cohort and their many accomplishments since graduating. They helped put this route up during their first immersion in Gunnison.
content.location: This route is the furthest South (climber's right) and next to a tree.

content.description:
This is one of the best climbs at the crag. It is steep and pumpy with technical moves and surprisingly positive holds. It shares the same first bolt, last bolt, and anchors with '

Toddler Massage

.'
content.location:
It is the third route from the left, just left of the black streak next to '

Shake and Bake

.'

content.description: It is the furthest left route and is a bit runout but lots of fun.
content.location: Breakdance is the furthest left route at this crag.
